section.p: Serna XSL-FO extensions usually use the se namespace prefix. It is defined as: http://www.syntext.com/XSL/Format-1.0

li.p: These FOs are automatically generated with a built-in template by the Serna XSLT engine under the following conditions. First, the document is edited in validation mode. Second, a built-in template is implicitly instantiated for every apply-templates if a required element must be present in the content, but several elements are possible.

note.p: This FO is generated and used internally, and should not be used explicitly in the stylesheet. You can see this FO in the FO dump file only when you execute "Dump FO Tree" from the Serna Tools menu.

li.p: This FO is automatically generated with a built-in template by the Serna XSLT engine when processing an entity reference. The Serna XSLT engine generates se:section for both the entity reference start and entity reference end. Behavior of section processing in the Serna XSLT engine is also controlled by the se:sections XSLT extension attribute.
